titleStmt.title: The ingenious and diverting letters of the Lady -- travels into Spain. Describing the devotions, nunneries, humours, customs, laws, militia, trade, diet, and recreations of that people. : intermixt with great variety of modern adventures, and surprising accidents: being the truest and best remarks extant on that court and countrey.
Relation du voyage d'Espagne. English
titleStmt.author: Aulnoy, Madame d' (Marie-Catherine), 1650 or 51-1705.

editionStmt.edition: The fourth edition, corrected, in three parts compleat.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Samuel Crouch, at the Corner of Pope's-Head-Alley next Cornhil,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Madame Marie-Catherine d'Aulnoy by Wing.
Reproduction of original in: William Andrews Clark Memorial Library, University of California, Los Angeles, California.
